context: Task description is extremely vague - 'Evaluate agent package' with minimal context. While repository exploration reveals this is the PostHog Agent SDK (a mature TypeScript framework wrapping Claude Agent SDK for Git-integrated AI task execution), the requested evaluation lacks specific objectives, success criteria, and scope definition.
blockers: Task description provides no specific evaluation criteria or deliverables
Unknown whether evaluation should assess code quality, architecture, functionality, performance, testing, or documentation
No definition of what 'evaluation' means in this context (audit, review, assessment, refactoring analysis?)
Unknown audience or purpose for evaluation results
No success metrics or acceptance criteria specified

questions.question: What specific aspect of the agent package should be evaluated?
options: Code quality and architecture review (examine design patterns, type safety, modularity, adherence to conventions)
Test coverage analysis and recommendations (assess gaps in automated testing and propose test strategy)
Performance evaluation (profile runtime, memory usage, identify bottlenecks, recommend optimizations)
Security audit (review API integrations, credential handling, Git operations, input validation)

questions.question: What should the evaluation deliverable be?
options: Written report with findings, scores, and recommendations for improvement areas
Actionable tasks and PRs to address identified issues or improvements
Presentation-ready summary of package strengths, weaknesses, and maturity assessment
Comparison against industry best practices and similar SDK/framework projects

questions.question: What is the primary goal of this evaluation?
options: Prepare for open-source release or public documentation updates
Identify refactoring priorities before next major version release
Assess readiness for production expansion or new feature development
Conduct due diligence for potential acquisition or partnership evaluation
